185499035.review:
a GIANT recommend, this is the most expansive sandbox in any vr game, ever

This game doesn't need a giant review, its far too expansive to cover everything.
Take and hold is essentially the only (major) non sandbox mode, and while initially this could be seen as a downside, everything and I mean EVERYTHING is customizable in take and hold, your guns, the difficulty, the enemies, the map, etc

Aside from that this game features a jaw dropping amount of weapons all depicted realistically but with gunplay that feels increadibly fun and satisfying and requiring a bit of skill to fully master. Every gun (and knife, and tool, and prop, you know where im going with this) can be played with and the guns (obviously) have a gigantic range of attachments with nearly no limit to what you could put on them

Anton, the lead dev, is an incredible part of the entire community and this is one of the best updated and managed games ive seen in my life even outside of vr. This game receives constant updates ranging between bug fixes/optimization to giant content drops adding another 10 hours of replayability to this massive game

Did I mention this game has full mod support? Nearly every single aspect of the game is moddable (Take and hold, guns, etc) To add even more content on top of the giant base game

I never look at games this way, but objectively this game is just a steal for its price. Well worth it, id buy it even if it was 100 dollars. 9.5/10

185494143.review:
Mosin Nagant doesn't work right/10

Also controls are kinda assy.  Of course most games like this that have a "Body" to put inventory in are usuallyt kinda assy with controls.
185494143.developer_response: The Mosin Nagant has a mechanical safety on its bolt (just like in Real Life). You must disengage this safety prior to being able to move the bolt.

185420128.review: It's the most realistic gun playground you can ask for, which made me, an European, more knowledgeable about guns than an average American. What a time to be alive.

185399702.review: A game by the player and for the player. Best VR game ever.

185395850.review:
8/10 game overall if you are looking for something to mess around in with guns,
BUT,
The lack of official mod support is incredibly infuriating. modding the game is a nightmare to do currently and feels like a chore. and its odd because a sandbox game like this would be perfect. otherwise its a almost perfect experience.
185395850.developer_response:
Adding "Mod Support" would not change level of complexity of modding the game. It would be, on average, the same number of total clicks. Migrating the mod scene to something like workshop would simply waste hundred's of people's time, migrating thousands of mods to Thunderstore, for no measurable benefit. We already work in concert with the folks behind the major mod frameworks to ensure compatibility and smooth version migrations.

Whatever benefit is in your head to something more 'official' is illusory.

185337464.review:
This game is a 100% yes, recommendation.

I hadnt realized I didnt write a review yet, but the new Bullshoot mode made me want to.

I would even recommend this game SOLELY based on the Bullshoot mode existing. If you ignore every other massive pieces of content this game has, the Bullshoot mode on its own is worth the asking price of the full game. 

Its genuinely some of the most fun Ive had in VR. 

Outside of that, most of your time will be spent in the "rogue-like" mode, Take and Hold. I would say  around 70 of my hours in this game are in that mode. Getting (at the time of writing) 94 hours out of ANY VR game, is absolutely insane and extremely rare. Getting 94 hours out of a 20 dollar VR game, is even more unheard of. 

Typically VR games just do not have that level of staying power, but this one absolutely does, and its not even finished yet (technically, but any other developer would call this finished, but anton is not just any other developer).

this game is just plain fun

long story short i love this game

184165367.review:
The developers attitude when people make valid game suggestions is not good at all.

May I remind you of what the early access, the message under the game states: "We’re still actively designing, work-shopping ideas, and listening and responding to what the player community is enjoying" "get involved with this game as it develops"

I made a suggestion to say being able to shoot through plant pots which you can not do in the games current state... to be told "I do not plan to ever change the behavior". IMO a game about messing around with guns should be able shoot through a plant pot etc, standard plinking stuff...

The developer has a real issue with his rude attitude which kind of makes me wish I didn't purchase this game. If I could turn back time I would not buy this game. Take a look at some of the posts and replies etc.

The political bias related to this game dev and community is a real shame. They say they are not politically biased but they clearly are - posts etc are silently deleted by them, whereas others political ones matching their agenda remain, guns, locations etc are not added due to the origin country or other political bias. The funny thing is if you had politics go the way you want it, guns would ironically be banned in the US, ha. Why don't you just keep things neutral? 

There are some night maps but don't expect any kind of basic dynamic lighting - the lights sources such as the flashlights etc do not generate any kind of dynamic shadows and in fact go straight through all walls and objects. I don't recall any 3D game with lighting this bad in memory.

184159241.review: good but please bring it to quest :(

184139585.review:
an absolute gem of a VR game 
considering it was one of the very first VR games on any platform and the fact that it still to this day feels amazing to play 
sure at the time of this review i may not have that many hours of play time 
but thats because i dont really do much when i do play it 

i mostly just go to the long shooting range and practice sniping 
which btw through this game and later going to a range i learned i am incredible at sniping 
its too bad im not cut out for the military. 
and its funny because i am trash at competitive multiplayer shooting games 

this game is fun and despite some of the controls being a bit all over the place from gun to gun and device to device 
its fun. 
i mean sometimes i dont even use the guns. one of my favorite things to do is go to the desert map and place a whole bunch of c4 in a stack and then launch various objects with it like buckets and roll targets 
or play with the giant pistol there by launching the explosive spread shot into the air and playing dodge the rain of death

the fact that this game is pretty much made by one person is amazing 
and i love how it still gets very frequent updates and stuff 

i played through both the western setting and the zombie stories and enjoyed them thoroughly 
i will say i dont care much for take and hold. but the various other game modes are a lot of fun 
i do wish there was at least one more story driven campaign style game mode 

even in its early access state which at the time of review Anton keeps telling us in every update video that oh its almost done its almost done and then that needle just gets pushed back 
personly im fine with that more content is more fun anyway 
but anyway 
even in its early access state id say it is actually worth more than its full asking price 
the game is great

184068706.review:
This game is a VR shooter killer. I've tried buying and playing multiple other VR shooters and none can compete with this one. It plays great on my mid-tier system (both modded and vanilla) and I’d imagine it would still be a solid experience on a lesser rig. I have been keeping up with the weekly dev logs for quite some time now and it's very clear that Anton (the dev) cares for this game a lot. An unprecedented amount of detail is put into this that screams “I love what I do!”. The updates are frequent and he’s very open about what he’s working on. As someone who has a tistic love of firearms, being able to operate the plethora of historical and modern pieces of kit is remarkable considering 95% or more of the guns in the game wouldn’t be able to be owned legally where I’m from *sigh*…Canada. I keep coming back to it so I highly recommend it if you enjoy them even somewhat. The game is a sandbox with a ton of stuff for you to try.

I just recently got into modding the game and it gave it a new and exciting world for me to dig a hole to put myself into - modular firearms. Being able to build one from scratch in whatever style, length, and caliber I want has given me a whole new level of love for what this game can do. Plus it gives the ability to play new game modes on completely different maps than what are in vanilla. Zombies - yup, supply raid/take and hold on a 747 - uh huh, and tons more to try. I can’t recommend this game enough. It could cost 3x what it does now, and it still would be worth it IMO. 

9.69/10 Nice!
